means: reference form 参考形式，基准形式

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含"改革，改变，改造"之意。
means: reform ： 指去恶扬善、弃旧图新，使变得完美，多用于社会、政治、经济方面，如体制、法律、机构等的改革。
transform ： 指既改变外部形体，又改变内部性质或功能。

sentence.Network_en: The government wanted to reform the institutions, to shake up the country.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府想要实施机构改革，整顿国家。

sentence.Network_en: The finance minister will continue to mastermind Poland's economic reform.
sentence.Network_cn: 财政部长将继续策划波兰的经济改革。

sentence.Network_en: The government took another step on the road to political reform.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府在实现政治改革的路上又迈进了一步。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb in the senses 'restore (peace') and 'bring back to the original condition'): from Old French reformer or Latin reformare, from re- 'back' + formare 'to form, shape'. The noun dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: Reform consists of changes and improvements to a law, social system, or institution. A reform is an instance of such a change or improvement.

example.ex: The party embarked on a programme of economic reform...
example.tran: 这个党开始进行经济改革。

example.ex: He has urged reform of the welfare system...
example.tran: 他极力主张进行福利制度改革。

entry.def: If someone reforms something such as a law, social system, or institution, they change or improve it.

example.ex: ...his plans to reform the country's economy...
example.tran: 他的国家经济改革计划

example.ex: A reformed party would have to win the approval of the people.
example.tran: 一个革新的政党需要赢得人民的认可。

entry.tran: （人）洗心革面；(使)改过自新；改造
entry.def: When someone reforms or when something reforms them, they stop doing things that society does not approve of, such as breaking the law or drinking too much alcohol.

example.ex: When his court case was coming up, James promised to reform...
example.tran: 他的案子即将开审的时候，詹姆斯保证会改过自新。

example.ex: We will try to reform him within the community.
example.tran: 我们将尽力在社区内部对他进行改造。

means.word_mean: 1. a change for the better as a result of correcting abuses;

sentences.sentence: "justice was for sale before the reform of the law courts"

means.word_mean: 2. a campaign aimed to correct abuses or malpractices;

sentences.sentence: "the reforms he proposed were too radical for the politicians"

means.word_mean: 3. self-improvement in behavior or morals by abandoning some vice;

sentences.sentence: "the family rejoiced in the drunkard's reform"

means.word_mean: 1. make changes for improvement in order to remove abuse and injustices;
2. bring, lead, or force to abandon a wrong or evil course of life, conduct, and adopt a right one;
5. improve by alteration or correction of errors or defects and put into a better condition;

sentences.sentence: "reform the health system in this country"
"the habitual cheater finally saw the light"

auth_sentence.content: That is a real short term market based reform.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is a real short term market based reform.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is a real short term market based reform.

auth_sentence.content: Reform has its own logic and its own momentum.
auth_sentence.res_content: Reform has its own logic and its own momentum.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Reform has its own logic and its own momentum.

auth_sentence.content: We are going to roll back Wall Street reform.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are going to roll back Wall Street reform.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are going to roll back Wall Street reform.

Sentence.sentence: It is harder to predict how Mr Obama's proposed reforms to the failing health-care system will turn out.
interested in political and economic reforms
Timely reform of government at all levels.

means.word_mean: 改革, 改良, 改造

sentences.en: The reform in teaching methods is warmly welcomed by students.
sentences.cn: 教学方法的改革受到了学生们的热烈欢迎。

sentences.en: The new law brought many social reforms.
sentences.cn: 新法引起了许多社会改革。

means.word_mean: 改革; 改造; 改善

sentences.en: You have had every chance to reform.
sentences.cn: 你已有了改过自新的各种机会。

sentences.en: We are reforming our economic system.
sentences.cn: 我们正在改革我们的经济体制。

jushi.english: The reform in teaching methods is warmly welcomed by students.
jushi.chinese: 教学方法的改革受到了学生们的热烈欢迎。

jushi.english: The new law brought many social reforms.
jushi.chinese: 新法带来了许多社会改革。

jushi.english: Harry has completely reformed—he's stopped taking drugs and got a regular job.
jushi.chinese: 哈利现在已经完全改过自新了——他已不吸毒,而且找到一份正当的工作。
